title: Love the Lord Your God
summary: Deuteronomy 6 contains the Shema, Israel’s central declaration of faith: to love the Lord with all their heart, soul, and strength. Moses urges the people to teach God’s commands to their children and to stay faithful in the land.

faq.question: What is the Shema?
faq.answer: A central declaration of faith: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one...’ (Deut. 6:4–5).

faq.question: How were families to keep God’s Word central?
faq.answer: By talking about it at home, writing it on doorposts, and teaching it to their children daily.
